urls.description: As the Government's roadmap out of lockdown is announced the Environment Agency chief calls for same effort in tackling the ‚Äúunseen pandemic‚Äù

tweets.text:
Powerful statement by Sir J Bevan @EnvAgency  "Much higher sea levels will take out most of the world‚Äôs cities, displace millions & make much of the rest of our land surface uninhabitable or unusable" Must not be ignored @KwasiKwarteng #SayNo2SizewellC 

https://t.co/D0mue7Gnw7

ENVIRONMENT AGENCY MONITORING STATION

The first @EnvAgencyMids monitoring station is now live. Councillors @SimonTagg and Stephen Sweeney walked the estate with me: there was quite a strong odour present, with momentary gusts of very strong odour.

https://t.co/9vl5xaQgzq https://t.co/l5ND433yaf

Our water supplies are under pressure from climate change, population growth and drought.

We've launched a consultation on our updated map of the areas where this pressure could be greatest.

Help us safeguard future water supplies. Share your views here: https://t.co/WBWHPEVE9u https://t.co/smkQXkHtCJ

tweets.text: One year on from #StormCiara, a ¬£10m package of work to repair flood embankments on the lower River Aire is making good progress. 18 defences have been repaired so far, to protect local communities from the risk of #flooding. https://t.co/C8Fy7i7K90 https://t.co/PllNyJlKU6

This week we‚Äôve completed a leakage test on a flood gate at #Gowdall near #Snaith, to test repairs we‚Äôve made to the seals. This is part of our repair programme of work to flood defences on the lower River Aire following #StormCiara https://t.co/usprzI5xDy

Visit today with @ChurnetFarmers co-ordinators at a large, intensive dairy farm where -back in 2016- @ChurnetValley @StaffsWildlife & the farmer constructed reedbeds & ponds to manage surplus yard run off. 

Need loads more of this!

(funding: @EnvAgencyMids & @HeritageFundUK) https://t.co/lbely4R0jD

urls.title: Waste carriers, brokers and dealers
urls.description: beta This is a trial service ‚Äì your feedback will help us to improve it. Home Search waste carriers, brokers and dealers People or businesses who transport, buy, sell or dispose of waste, or arrange for someone els e to do so, must be registered. To check a registration, enter the registration number or business name: only carry waste they produced in the course of carrying out their business unless it is construction or demolition waste only carry (carrier), arrange (broker) or deal (dealer) in: animal

tweets.text:
Before you ask anyone to take your waste away for you, check they have a Waste Carrier Licence on the @envagency register: https://t.co/mqXVo8tpVf
We all have a #DutyofCare for the waste we produce. Don't make it easy for #flytippers
#KeepKentClean #Flytipping https://t.co/EshR8al70D

tweets.text:
We're pleased that we have been chosen to be the environmental partner for the @OxfordFAS. Our role will be to help plan for the long term environmental, climate and human health and wellbeing benefits of the scheme.

Read our full news story: https://t.co/fhdu9nlvhE https://t.co/I1JayEajtB

Calling all farmers! üì¢ Do you want to learn how to easily, legally dispose of plastic on your farm? Look no further: @WestcountryRT and @EnvAgency have produced a fantastic new advice sheet to help you get started üëá
https://t.co/3HZXT3gAYO

Just to remind you all that just 24 hours ago the @EnvAgency admitted it will no longer be publishing serious pollution incidents and won't be recording them against their annual performance targets. https://t.co/Cu3VPjycTa

Our officers have been out checking for stockpiling of waste tyres, which can be a fire hazard. If you spot any large piles of tyres, call our 24-hour free hotline on 0800 807060. https://t.co/xiKd8BmdRO
@whamsfarm @LuntMeadows @seftoncouncil Hi Neil - Please see our previous response to this here ‚û°Ô∏èhttps://t.co/Kh16D9Ux7L

Beautiful sunny afternoon to check on progress @DCfieldteamsEA project at Trekeivesteps.
New larch clad hut looking good. Can‚Äôt wait for the end result, safeguarding our hydrometric data collection for @EnvAgencySW for years to come #waterresources #floodwarning https://t.co/nBi50GC88g

Great aerial footage of our team working with @EnvAgencyNW flying one-tonne bags across the reserve at Lunt Meadows, to fix the breach in the River Alt, after recent flooding. The work will make it safe again for wildlife and visitors. https://t.co/WFk4Oi21ba

No need to miss out on the Farm Update North (supported by @NorthumbrianH2O)  event with guest speaker @DefraGovUK @JanetHughes (extensive Q&As) & presentations by supporting partners @Ruralpay @DefraFAS @EnvAgencyYNE @ForestryComm  View recording>>> https://t.co/ijnkOP3QO1 https://t.co/rsMfODTj1g

Makes no sense that to 'protect' Coggeshall from flooding, @EnvAgency thinks a ¬£25m project (dam & quarry) on the Blackwater will help - look at the map - flooding from Robins Brook & surface water is a high proportion of the risk  @piersmeyler @BW_Times @SarahPhillips8 https://t.co/uNeNgbpqj9

Thank you @TheParksTrust, @EnvAgencySE & @AnglianWater for this interesting article on #MiltonKeynes' flood defences. How long do you think the balancing lakes etc will suffice as the climate changes? https://t.co/1BRgm6OGFQ

tweets.text: @sherbertlemon42 @NewsNBC @Sotlive @EnvAgency disgusting. its constant. my patients in hospital were complaining yesterday

@RosieP4 @EnvAgency @piersmeyler @BW_Times @SarahPhillips8 We‚Äôve got the same here in Kent. The 4,000 houses envisaged won‚Äôt flood as they‚Äôre on a slope. But that slope, once covered in concrete/asphalt, will dump all its rainfall into the Medway, with dire results for #Yalding and #Maidstone, regular flood victims already. https://t.co/VuWUbIancA
@StinkStopthe @EnvAgencyMids @PHE_uk Look at this domestic air monitoring.  Residents, including myself, have raised this time and time again.  We need action now to protect our health. #stopthestink

There was some high water on the river Kent (a SSSI & SAC) recently, silting the footpath up.

An engineer was at the sewage works, (might be there for another reason?). I saw no birds that day.

Most of went in the river is in Morecambe Bay now. 
Or still hangs in the willows. https://t.co/xk5DUWBbYH
@DaveJonesNuL This is the quality of air in Newcastle under Lyme https://t.co/mE8fSOG9au
